title: Add comprehensive integration tests for TUI workflows
description:
## Technical Debt
Add end-to-end integration tests for core TUI workflows.

## Problem
Current test coverage:
- ✅ Good: Unit tests for parser, state, storage, theme, config
- ❌ Missing: Integration tests for UI flows
- ❌ Missing: Tests for dialogs and user interactions
- ❌ Missing: End-to-end workflow tests

## Implementation
1. Set up tcell simulation framework for testing
2. Test core workflows:
   - Issue creation flow (open dialog, fill form, submit)
   - Navigation flow (j/k, gg, G, search)
   - Filter flow (activate filters, verify results)
   - Edit flow (open edit dialog, modify fields, save)
   - View switching (list ↔ tree)
   - Theme switching
3. Test error conditions:
   - Invalid input validation
   - bd command failures
   - Database errors
4. Performance tests:
   - Large issue sets (1000+ issues)
   - Rapid navigation
   - Memory leaks

## Test Structure
```
tests/
├── integration/
│   ├── navigation_test.go
│   ├── creation_test.go
│   ├── editing_test.go
│   ├── filtering_test.go
│   └── views_test.go
├── e2e/
│   ├── full_workflow_test.go
│   └── error_scenarios_test.go
└── performance/
    ├── large_datasets_test.go
    └── benchmarks_test.go
```

## Tools
- tcell simulation (github.com/gdamore/tcell/v2/simscreen)
- testify for assertions
- go-golden for snapshot testing

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] Integration tests for all major workflows
- [ ] Tests run in CI
- [ ] Code coverage >70% overall
- [ ] Performance benchmarks established
- [ ] Documentation for running tests

## Estimated Effort
2-3 days

## Value
**High** - Prevents regressions, enables confident refactoring

## Files
- tests/integration/ (new)
- tests/e2e/ (new)
- .github/workflows/test.yml (update)

title: Plugin system for custom commands and views
description:
## Feature
Extensible plugin system to allow users to add custom commands, views, and integrations.

## User Stories
1. As a power user, I want to write custom commands in Go or Lua
2. As a user, I want to add custom views or panels
3. As a user, I want to integrate with custom tools/APIs

## Implementation

### Plugin Architecture
1. Plugin interface:
   ```go
   type Plugin interface {
       Name() string
       Commands() []Command
       Views() []View
       Hooks() []Hook
   }
   ```
2. Plugin discovery:
   - Load from ~/.beads-tui/plugins/
   - Manifest file (plugin.yaml) with metadata
   - Optional: Lua scripting support
3. Plugin types:
   - Command plugins (add new keybindings/commands)
   - View plugins (custom panels/displays)
   - Hook plugins (intercept events)
   - Integration plugins (external APIs)

### Example Plugins
```lua
-- ~/.beads-tui/plugins/jira-sync/plugin.lua
function sync_to_jira(issue)
  -- Custom logic to sync issue to JIRA
  jira.create_issue({
    summary = issue.title,
    description = issue.description
  })
end

register_command("jira-sync", {
  key = "J",
  description = "Sync issue to JIRA",
  handler = sync_to_jira
})
```

### Plugin API
- Access to issue data
- Execute bd commands
- Call external APIs
- Update TUI state
- Show notifications/dialogs

## Security
- Sandboxing (restrict file system access)
- Permission system (user approval for sensitive ops)
- Code signing for distribution
- Plugin marketplace (optional future)

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] Plugin interface defined
- [ ] Plugin discovery and loading works
- [ ] Can register custom commands
- [ ] Can add custom views
- [ ] Lua scripting support
- [ ] Example plugins documented
- [ ] Security sandboxing implemented

## Estimated Effort
2+ weeks

## Value
**Medium** - Enables advanced customization for power users

## Notes
This is a major architectural change. Consider carefully if needed vs built-in features.

## Alternative
Instead of full plugin system, could support:
- Shell script hooks (simpler, already have $EDITOR integration)
- Config-based custom commands (map key to bd command)

title: Advanced navigation: history, jump to parent/child/blocker
description:
## Feature
Enhanced navigation for quickly moving between related issues.

## User Stories
1. As a user, I want to navigate back to previously viewed issues (history)
2. As a user, I want to jump directly to a parent/child/blocker issue
3. As a user, I want breadcrumb navigation for issue relationships

## Implementation

### Navigation History
- Track last N viewed issues (stack or circular buffer)
- Keybindings:
  - `Ctrl-o` - Go back (older)
  - `Ctrl-i` - Go forward (newer)
- Status bar shows position: `[2/10]`

### Relationship Navigation
- Jump to related issues:
  - `gp` - Go to parent
  - `gc` - Go to first child
  - `gb` - Go to blocker
  - `gd` - Go to dependent (what this blocks)
- If multiple options, show picker dialog
- Works in both list and tree view

### Breadcrumb Trail
Display in detail panel or status bar:
```
Home > [deleted:tui-ywv] (epic) > [deleted:tui-nsn] (this issue)
```

### Recent Issues
- `gr` - Show recent issues list (quick picker)
- Shows last 20 issues with timestamps
- Clear history option

## Example Flow
```
User views: [deleted:tui-ywv] (epic)
  Navigates to child: [deleted:tui-nsn]
    Views blocker: [deleted:tui-8vc]
      Press Ctrl-o → back to [deleted:tui-nsn]
      Press gp → jump to [deleted:tui-ywv]
```

## Keybindings
- `Ctrl-o` - Navigate back (older in history)
- `Ctrl-i` - Navigate forward (newer in history)
- `gp` - Jump to parent issue
- `gc` - Jump to child (prompts if multiple)
- `gb` - Jump to blocker (prompts if multiple)
- `gd` - Jump to dependent
- `gr` - Show recent issues

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] History tracks last 50 issues
- [ ] Ctrl-o/Ctrl-i navigate history
- [ ] gp/gc/gb/gd jump to related issues
- [ ] Picker shown when multiple options
- [ ] Works in both views
- [ ] History persists across sessions (optional)
- [ ] Breadcrumb trail displayed

## Estimated Effort
2 days

## Value
**High** - Significantly improves navigation in complex issue hierarchies

## Files
- internal/navigation/ (new package)
- internal/state/state.go (add history methods)

title: Implement bulk operations with visual mode
description:
## Feature
Add vim-style visual mode for multi-selecting issues and performing batch operations.

## User Story
As a user, I want to select multiple issues and perform batch operations (close, change priority, add labels) to improve productivity.

## Implementation
1. Add visual mode state (triggered by `v` or `V` key)
2. Track selected issues in state
3. Visual indicators for selected issues (highlight/checkboxes)
4. Batch operation commands:
   - Bulk close with optional reason
   - Bulk priority change
   - Bulk label add/remove
   - Bulk status change
5. Confirmation dialog before batch execution

## Keybindings
- `v` - Enter visual mode (select current issue)
- `V` - Enter visual line mode (select all visible)
- `j/k` - Extend selection up/down
- `Space` - Toggle selection on current issue
- `ESC` - Exit visual mode
- `:close` - Close selected issues
- `:priority N` - Set priority for selected
- `:label add <label>` - Add label to selected
- `:status <status>` - Set status for selected

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] Visual mode highlights selected issues
- [ ] Can select/deselect with j/k/Space
- [ ] Batch close works with confirmation
- [ ] Batch priority change works
- [ ] Batch label operations work
- [ ] Status bar shows selection count
- [ ] ESC clears selection and exits visual mode

## Estimated Effort
2-3 days

## Value
**Very High** - Major productivity improvement for managing multiple issues

title: Add saved filter presets
description:
## Feature
Allow users to save frequently-used filter combinations and access them with quick keybindings.

## User Story
As a user, I want to save my commonly-used filters (e.g., \"My P1 bugs\", \"Blocked features\") and access them quickly rather than re-typing filters each time.

## Implementation
1. Extend config system to store filter presets
2. FilterPreset struct: name, priority, type, status, labels, assignee
3. Save/load from config file
4. UI for managing presets (add, edit, delete)
5. Keybindings for quick access (1-9 for presets)

## Config Format
```yaml
filter_presets:
  - name: "My P1s"
    key: "1"
    priority: [1]
    assignee: "andy"
  - name: "Blocked Features"
    key: "2"
    status: ["blocked"]
    type: ["feature"]
```

## Keybindings
- `F` - Open filter preset manager
- `1-9` - Apply preset 1-9
- `0` - Clear all filters

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] Can create named filter presets
- [ ] Presets persist in config file
- [ ] Quick access with number keys
- [ ] Preset manager UI for add/edit/delete
- [ ] Status bar shows active preset name
- [ ] Default presets: "All", "Ready", "Blocked", "My Issues"

## Estimated Effort
1 day

## Value
**High** - Significant workflow improvement for power users

title: Epic progress tracking with visual indicators
description:
## Feature
Show visual progress indicators for epics based on completion of child issues.

## User Story
As a user, I want to see at a glance how much of an epic is complete, based on the status of its child issues.

## Implementation
1. Calculate epic completion percentage:
   - Count total children (recursively)
   - Count closed children
   - Percentage = closed / total * 100
2. Display progress in multiple locations:
   - Progress bar in detail panel
   - Percentage in tree view next to epic
   - Color-coded indicator (red < 25%, yellow 25-75%, green > 75%)
3. Epic-specific dashboard view
4. Subtask breakdown (which children are blocking completion)

## Display Examples
```
[●] [deleted:tui-ywv] [P1] [75%] ████████░░ Build beads-tui
    ├── [✓] [deleted:tui-nsn] Basic layout
    ├── [✓] [deleted:tui-xh1] Issue segregation
    ├── [○] [deleted:tui-79b] Write tests  <- blocking completion
    └── [✓] [deleted:tui-bne] Tree view
```

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] Epic detail panel shows progress bar
- [ ] Tree view shows completion percentage
- [ ] Percentage calculated from all descendants
- [ ] Color-coded based on completion
- [ ] Epic dashboard shows breakdown by status
- [ ] Works with nested epics

## Estimated Effort
2 days

## Value
**High** - Better visibility into project progress

title: Git integration suite (branch, commit, PR workflows)
description:
## Epic
Comprehensive Git integration to streamline development workflows directly from the TUI.

## User Stories
1. As a developer, I want to create a feature branch from an issue with proper naming conventions
2. As a developer, I want to generate commit message templates that reference the issue
3. As a developer, I want to create PRs with issue context pre-filled
4. As a developer, I want to see which commits are linked to an issue

## Implementation Phases

### Phase 1: Branch Management
- Create branch from issue (with naming template: `feature/tui-xyz-short-title`)
- Detect current branch and show in detail panel
- Switch to issue's branch if it exists
- Keybinding: `gb` (git branch)

### Phase 2: Commit Integration
- Generate commit message template (includes issue ID and title)
- Copy commit message to clipboard
- Link commits to issues (parse git log for issue IDs)
- Show commit history in detail panel
- Keybinding: `gc` (git commit template)

### Phase 3: PR/MR Creation
- Create GitHub/GitLab PR from TUI
- Pre-fill PR title/description with issue details
- Auto-link PR to issue
- Show PR status in detail panel
- Keybinding: `gp` (git PR)

### Phase 4: Status Integration
- Show git status for issue (branch, commits, PR)
- Detect if branch is ahead/behind
- Show PR review status
- CI/CD status indicators

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] Can create branch with naming convention
- [ ] Commit message template includes issue context
- [ ] PR creation works for GitHub/GitLab
- [ ] Issue detail shows linked commits
- [ ] Branch switching works
- [ ] Git status integrated into TUI

## Estimated Effort
2 weeks

## Value
**Very High** - Seamless integration between issue tracking and development workflow

## Dependencies
- Requires `gh` CLI for GitHub (optional)
- Requires `glab` CLI for GitLab (optional)
- Falls back to git commands

title: Export and reporting system (markdown, CSV, JSON, HTML)
description:
## Feature
Export filtered issue lists and generate reports in multiple formats.

## User Stories
1. As a user, I want to export current filtered view to markdown for documentation
2. As a user, I want to export to CSV for analysis in Excel/spreadsheets
3. As a user, I want to generate HTML reports for stakeholders
4. As a user, I want to print issue details for offline review

## Implementation
1. Export engine with multiple formatters:
   - Markdown (table or list format)
   - CSV (with configurable columns)
   - JSON (full issue data)
   - HTML (styled report with CSS)
2. Export dialog:
   - Choose format
   - Select fields to include
   - Destination (file or clipboard)
3. Report templates:
   - Sprint report (completed issues)
   - Status report (current state)
   - Epic report (hierarchical view with progress)
   - Custom report builder

## Keybindings
- `ex` - Open export dialog
- `ep` - Print current issue to file

## Export Dialog
```
┌─── Export Issues ───────────────────┐
│ Format:  [Markdown ▼]               │
│          CSV                         │
│          JSON                        │
│          HTML                        │
│                                      │
│ Fields:  [✓] ID                     │
│          [✓] Title                   │
│          [✓] Status                  │
│          [✓] Priority                │

│                                      │

│          Clipboard                   │
│                                      │
│    [Export]  [Cancel]                │
└──────────────────────────────────────┘
```

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] Export to markdown works
- [ ] Export to CSV works
- [ ] Export to JSON works
- [ ] Export to HTML with styling works
- [ ] Can select which fields to include
- [ ] Export to file or clipboard

title: Assignee workflow and filtering
description:

title: Issue templates for common workflows
description:
## Feature
Pre-defined issue templates to speed up creation of common issue types.

## User Stories
1. As a user, I want a bug report template with standard fields
2. As a user, I want a feature request template
3. As a user, I want to create custom templates for my workflow

## Implementation
1. Template system:
   - Template files in ~/.beads-tui/templates/
   - Built-in templates (bug, feature, epic, task)
   - Custom user templates
2. Template format (YAML or Markdown):
   ```yaml
   name: Bug Report
   type: bug
   priority: 1
   description: |
     ## Bug Description
     [Describe the bug]
     
     ## Steps to Reproduce
     1. 
     2. 
     
     ## Expected Behavior
     
     ## Actual Behavior
     
   acceptance: |
     - [ ] Bug is fixed
     - [ ] Test added
     - [ ] No regression
   ```
3. Template selection in create dialog
4. Template management UI (list, edit, delete)

## Keybindings
- `a` - Create issue (shows template selector)
- `Ctrl-t` - Template manager

## Create Dialog with Templates
```
┌─── Create New Issue ────────────────┐
│ Template: [Bug Report ▼]            │
│           Feature Request            │
│           Epic                       │
│           Task                       │
│           Custom...                  │
│           None (blank)               │
│                                      │
│ Title: [________________________]   │
│ ...                                  │
└──────────────────────────────────────┘
```

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] Built-in templates (bug, feature, epic, task)
- [ ] Templates pre-fill description/acceptance
- [ ] Can create custom templates
- [ ] Template manager UI
- [ ] Templates stored in config dir
- [ ] Template selection in create dialog

## Estimated Effort
2 days

## Value
**Medium** - Improves consistency and speeds up issue creation

## Files
- internal/templates/ (new package)
- ~/.beads-tui/templates/ (user templates)

title: Epic: bd upstream PRs
description: Collection of features that require changes to the bd CLI itself. These are blocked until we submit PRs to the beads project.

title: Add --type flag to bd update command
description:
Currently bd update does not support changing issue type. This prevents the TUI from implementing type shortcuts (Tf, Tb, Tt, Te, Tc, Td).

The storage layer already supports updating issue_type, but the CLI command lacks the flag.

Needed: Add --type flag to cmd/bd/update.go to allow changing issue type after creation.

title: Restore type shortcuts from feature branch
description:
After bd update --type is merged, restore the type shortcuts code from branch feature/type-shortcuts-for-bd-pr.

The branch contains:
- Two-character type shortcuts (Tf, Tb, Tt, Te, Tc, Td)
- Centralized multi-key handling architecture
- Help screen documentation

Steps:
1. Verify bd update --type works
2. Cherry-pick or merge from feature/type-shortcuts-for-bd-pr
3. Test all type shortcuts
4. Update CLAUDE.md with type shortcuts

title: Add --comments flag to bd show command
description:
Currently you need two separate commands to see an issue and its comments:
- bd show <issue-id> - Shows metadata only
- bd comments <issue-id> - Shows comments only

This is inefficient for both humans and AI agents. The TUI has to run both commands to display issue details.

Proposal: Add --comments flag to bd show:
```bash
bd show tui-123 --comments
```

This would display:
1. Issue metadata (current bd show output)
2. Separator
3. Comments (current bd comments output)

Benefits:
- Fewer commands to run
- Better for scripting/automation
- More intuitive UX
- TUI can use single command for detail panel
